Haxe Roundup № 347

by Skial Bainn published on Monday 7th December 2015
Suggest a link Correct this issue

Welcome to the latest edition of the Haxe Roundup. Haxe is a high level, strictly typed programming language and cross-compiler.

News from the Community

News and Articles

  • Static blog engine made with Haxe by Ashes999.
  • Filestat Ctime on Unix by Ashes999.
  • Where’s My Dog Devlog #10 by Eduardo Lopes.
  • Introduction to Haxe by Itzik Arzoni.
  • HaxeFlixel Tutorial - Tiled Map Editor by Justin C.

Game releases

  • Find Pair 2048 for Android by Maksym Kotov.
  • Zany Faces for iOS by Osaka Red LLC.

Pictures and Demos

  • HXCPP debugger call stack in Visual Studio Code by Jeff Ward.
  • How to use hxcppObjectGraphViewer via Lars Doucet.
  • Speed Sort HaxeFlixel LoadingJam Gif by Gamepopper.
  • HaxeFlixel JRPG Gif by Ingénoire.
  • Instanced rendering in Kha by Lubos Lenco.
  • Interesting refactoring glitches using luxe engine Gif by Tilman Schmidt.
  • ChopEngine’s mint renderer featuring Corgi the Destroyer of Worlds by Ohmnivore.
  • HaxeUI v2 demos for NME, PixiJS, OpenFL, Flambe & luxe engine by Ian Harrigan.
  • StablexUI v2 Flash and HTML5 demos by Alexander Kuzmenko.
  • NaNoGenMo 2015 Haxe entry by Daniel.
  • Validate JSON files at compile time by Mark Knol.
  • Abstract OneOf<A, B> example by Justo Delgado.
  • Auto update g/set when you rename properties in FlashDevelop by Slava_Ra.
  • Video player Chrome App written in Haxe by Ryan Davis.

Jobs

Updates from the Haxe core

44 commits have been made to the Haxe compiler in the last week, with 11 combined pull requests merged across the Haxe ecosystem.

  • Inline super() calls
  • Support import.hx
  • Internal Changes for Haxe 4

You can start using the latest features by grabbing a nightly build of Haxe.

Have a good week everyone!
